title: Intermediate Collaborative Educational Game Development Course: Maximizing Social Learning Effects Through Iterative Testing (Focused on Citizenship and Collective Problem-Solving Skills)

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced learning completion and high-level project experience (foundational grasp of social studies pedagogy, basic concepts of citizenship education and social relationship-building)
context.additional_context: Teamwork-based projects in digital device-provided environments, with twice-weekly synchronous sessions + asynchronous collaborative tasks (emphasizing game elements to promote social interaction, integrating social studies content like history, geography, and economics)

learning_goals: Learners can draft three types of design documents (e.g., quizzes, simulations, role-plays) that integrate social studies educational goals (e.g., fostering citizenship, conflict resolution) with game mechanics (e.g., experience points, rewards, leveling up) by applying social learning theory (Bandura). Each draft must achieve an "Excellent" rating in at least two of the three rubric criteria: goal clarity, mechanism appropriateness, and application of learning theory
Refining the game prototype at least three times through target learner testing (enhancing citizenship-building elements and adding social relationship improvement mechanisms)
Achieving 80% completion of team-based game content using a collaborative feedback system (promoting collective problem-solving skills and social interaction)
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
